metadata.titel_preek: King of Kings and Lord of Lords

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God establishes an eternal kingdom through the Word and the incarnation of Christ to conquer the powers of Sin and Death, reclaiming humanity from their own failed self-rule.

tekstueel_bewijs: The God of Israel has spoken
God has made him both Lord and Messiah
He drew into himself all the wickedness... and in the resurrection, conquered it
His dominion is Light; his dominion is Truth; his dominion is Life

zender.identificatie: The Word of God / The Spirit
tekstueel_bewijs: The Spirit of the Lord speaks by me
The mouth of the Lord hath spoken it

ontvanger.identificatie: Humanity / The Hearer / The Son (in the story of the OD)
tekstueel_bewijs: My son belongs to God. Nothing can change that.
Baptism is the action of God in this world
The descent of God from the eternal realm

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin, Death, and the Illusion of Self-Rule
tekstueel_bewijs: This world of Sin and Death
We want ourselves to be rulers of our own lives
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not merely bad behavior but 'Sin and Death' as ontological powers that humans cannot defeat.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human attempt to be 'captain of my soul' and the subsequent failure/collapse of that project.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer / Modern Man
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (human effort) is shown to be a total failure, which necessitates the primary program (God's intervention).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: The Word → Eternal Life → The Beloved Children

voorbeelden_god_subject: God has made him both Lord and Messiah
He drew into himself all the wickedness
The Lord swore to David a sure oath
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We want ourselves to be rulers
We choose to think of him as less

voorbeelden: Whom do we want to be ruler?
We should at least acknowledge that this is what it says
He can speak through human beings
Conquered it because he came from the world where death has no dominion

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on God's 'Ability' (Pouvoir) to act where humans have lost all power. It is a theology of divine capacity.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From the illusion of S1 (egalitarianism/self-rule) to the reality of S2 (death/OD), then to ~S2 (the Cross) and finally S1 (Resurrection).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found in the Incarnation—God entering S2 to bring the hearer to S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; death is treated as a literal, crushing reality.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. It explicitly attacks the idea of Jesus as a 'moral exemplar' and insists on God as the primary actor in history and baptism.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: I am the master of my fate

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God has made him both Lord and Messiah
Ruler of this world of Sin and Death

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The preacher explicitly rejects exemplarism, calling it a 'major movement' that strips away Christ's transcendence.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: David is not an example of virtue, but the recipient of an 'everlasting covenant' despite his 'enormous sins'.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and surrender ('I can let it go').
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic; salvation is entirely God's work.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the failure of human self-rule to the victory of Christ's rule is seamless and logically consistent.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'I am the captain of my soul' and the reality of a son's death.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: In the resurrection, conquered it—conquered it because he came from the world where death has no dominion.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit provides the Word (Savoir/Savoir-dire) to the prophets.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Fatal; it is a 'dominion' that humans cannot escape on their own.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the Subject. The hearer is correctly positioned as the Receiver of a covenant they did not initiate.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is appropriate for a Christ the King sermon.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: The concluding 'Fight the good fight' provides the necessary Devoir (obligation) as a response to the Pouvoir.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (God's rule) clearly precedes and enables Ethics (fighting the good fight).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This is a masterclass in theocentric preaching. It avoids the trap of moralism by grounding every human action in the prior, definitive action of God.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis might focus on the 'Lion King' anecdote, Greimas shows that this anecdote serves to establish the 'Sender' of the narrative (the innate human need for a King).
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the meaning of 'Kurios'; actantial analysis shows that 'Kurios' functions as the Subject who possesses the 'Pouvoir-faire' that the hearer lacks.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that the sermon's power comes from the 'Subject-Switch'—moving the hearer from the failed Subject of their own life to the Receiver of Christ's dominion.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'Rutledge Rule' effectively, ensuring that the heavy lifting of the narrative is done by God.
